overview: Grant Halverson joined GFG Group in 2007 from the research and advisory company McLean Roche where, as a founding partner, he helped establish a multi-million dollar research and advisory company specialising in payment systems, credit cards, retail banking, funds management, insurance and related technologies operating in Europe, Asia and North America. Prior to McLean Roche, Grant Halverson was regional executive director for Citibank Asia, where his responsibilities included business acquisitions and strategic options for the worldâ€™s largest bank. Prior to Citibank Asia, he was managing director of Diners Club Australia for 11 years. From 1982-1988, he held senior positions with NZI Bank in New Zealand including general manager consumer banking, and general manager Diners Club. Recently, he served on a Financial Services Committee advising the Prime Minister of Australia on developing strategies to make Sydney a regional financial services centre.
